span.span: Pull up to Buses parked outside of Speer, Granville and, DuVall

p.span: Deer Lodge Elementary has available free breakfasts and lunches for the duration of the school closure. The current closure order is through April 10. However, due to the number of calls the school is receiving about meals should the closure be extended, we are publishing this order form. If we are ordered back to school, meals will resume at school as usual.

Any youth 18 years old and younger is invited to participate. Make your order based on the number of children eating that day. Each child's order will include a breakfast and a lunch. Please complete one form per family.
All meals will meet state and federal nutrition guidelines, but due to the grab-and-go model, there will not be a set menu.
If you need to make a change to a submitted form or do not have access to the internet, please call Theresa at 846-1553 ext. *301 to place your order.
If you select to pick up meals at the school, please note that they will be available from 12:00 PM-12:30 PM.

p.span: Schools Closed by Governor through April 10th
Governor Bullock has ordered Montana Schools to remain closed through April 10th. Deer Lodge Schools will implement our Off Site Instruction Plan beginning March 30th.
Below is a letter that outlines when and how to pick up your child’s schoolwork packet, as well as outlining how we will continue to provide lunch and breakfasts for our students.

Please see Special Board meeting for details and agenda. If you have any questions or feedback on the offsite instruction plan please contact me at rsimpson@deerlodgeschools.org or by phone 846-1553 ext. *401.

hr.p: RE: School Provided Breakfast and Lunch during closure.

p.span: Deer Lodge Elementary is making available free breakfasts and lunches for the duration of the school closure. Students from Deer Lodge Elementary and Powell County High School are invited to participate. Signing up for each date indicates that you will pick up a lunch for that day and a breakfast for the next day. Please complete one form per family. The sign up deadline for each day's pick up will be 10 AM unless you sign up for both weeks at once. Meals will be available for pick up from 12:00-12:30 PM.

br.span: All meals will meet state and federal nutrition guidelines, but due to the grab-and-go model, there will not be a set menu.

If you need to make a change to a submitted form or do not have access to the internet, please call Theresa at 846-1553 ext. *301 to place your order.
Pick up for meals will be as follows using the first letter of the last name of the person completing the order form at the bottom of this page:

N-Z: DuVall

hr.p: DEER LODGE SCHOOLS BOARD POLICY MANUAL

span.span: Thank you for visiting our website. I am very proud to be the superintendent of Deer Lodge Schools. Our district sits in the pristine mountain valley of Powell County in the great community of Deer Lodge. Deer Lodge Schools is a K-8 school district consisting of three different schools: OD Speer, K-2; Granville Stuart, 3-6; and E F Duvall, 7-8. We currently have 420 students, and 35 teachers. I am in my 10th year as superintendent of schools. When I applied for this position, it was about more than just employment; it was about bringing my children to a district that could challenge and facilitate them as learners. I truly believe that is what we do at Deer Lodge Schools. We have great teachers that truly care about student success in academics as well as emotional and social development, and our staff goes above and beyond to support all aspects of our school day. We also enjoy strong commitment and support for education from the Deer Lodge community; from parents to business owners and community members, we continue to work together to do what’s best for kids.
